abstract: Competition for Home Depot‘s wholesale supply business is already heating up, even though the company has yet to formally announce an auction. And the roster of interested bidders reads like a private equity hall of fame. According to The Financial Times, three teams of private equity firms have formed to consider bids for the business, which could go for about $11 billion.
lead_paragraph: Competition for Home Depot‘s wholesale supply business is already heating up, even though the company has yet to formally announce an auction. And the roster of interested bidders reads like a private equity hall of fame. According to The Financial Times, three teams of private equity firms have formed to consider bids for the business, which could go for about $11 billion.

headline.main: Private Equity Teams Up for Home Depot Auction, Report Says
